sentences: Daria Kawashima (川島だりあ, Kawashima Daria, born 21 March 1967), known before as Miki Kawashima, is a Japanese musical composer, singer-songwriter, lyricist under Being Inc. records.
section: N/A
== Biography ==
== Biography ==

sentences: In years 1986–1988, she debut as a Miki Kawashima with single Silk no Kuchibiru under CBS Sony label.
section: == Biography ==

sentences: Three years later debuted as a soloist using her full name with single Shiny Day under Zain Records label.
section: == Biography ==

sentences: Since joining to the Being agency she has composed and write several songs for artist as Zard, Deen, later in 21st century for Aiuchi Rina.
section: == Biography ==

sentences: In 1992, she composed under alias name Tetsuya Komoro famous Anime song Moonlight Densetsu which was used in Anime television series Sailor Moon.
section: == Biography ==

sentences: In years 1993–2008 she was active as a leader in her own band Feel so Bad.
section: == Biography ==

sentences: In 2003 she participated in cover album The Hit Parade covering Gedō's Hyun Hyun produced by Tak Matsumoto from B'z.
section: == Biography ==

sentences: In 2016 she came back to the music industry with digital album release Life Now and active as an independent singer.
section: == Biography ==

sentences: Some of her music videoclips are included in musicvideo DVD series 90s Being Rock Hits.
section: == Biography ==
== Discography ==
== Discography ==

sentences: During her solo career as Daria Kawashima she released four singles, 2 studio, 1 digital and 1 compilation album.
